meanings.definition: Lacking qualities traditionally associated with masculinity.
meanings.sent1: The boy felt unmanlier when he cried in front of his friends.
meanings.sent2: He was teased for being unmanlier than the other boys in the class.
meanings.sent3: The unmanlier puppy preferred playing with dolls instead of toy cars.
meanings.sent4: His unmanlier demeanor made him stand out among the rugged group of men.
meanings.sent5: The unmanlier flower was delicate and graceful, unlike its robust counterparts.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is less manly or masculine.
meanings.sent1: He ran unmanlier than his brother, with a light and graceful stride.
meanings.sent2: The soldier fought unmanlier, avoiding direct confrontation.
meanings.sent3: He sang unmanlier than the other contestants, but his voice was sweet.
meanings.sent4: The dancer moved unmanlier than the rest, but his performance was captivating.
meanings.sent5: The wind blew unmanlier that day, gently rustling the leaves in the trees.
